result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon K Lockett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.
If revoked, Court allows HUBER for work only.

miscConds.notes:
*   Defendant to provide aq DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.    
*   Restitution is set at $0.00.
*   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or combination of both.
*   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.

*   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
*   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: *   Successfully complete 40 hours of community service.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon K Lockett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon K Lockett in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Henry Lockett.


Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS. If revoked, Court allows HUBER for work only.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Defendant to provide aq DNA sample and pay
          the DNA surcharge.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by the end of
          probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.    
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or
          combination of both.
     *   Successfully complete 40 hours of community
          service.
     *   No firearms.
     *   Restitution is set at $0.00.

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit,received and filed

Defendant Brandon K Lockett in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea hearing.  Negotiations placed on the record by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and elements of the offense, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a judgment of conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Court ordered jury trial date of 4/25/16 vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon K Lockett in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial. Defense counsel requests a projected guilty plea date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon K Lockett in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defense counsel requests to set case for final pretrial and jury trial.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon K Lockett in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense needs time to review discovery and requests another pretrial date.  State requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon K Lockett in court with attorney Geneve McKinley for Hazel Jean Washington.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a pretrial conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon K Lockett in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel.  Defendant needs more time to retain private counsel. Court grants one more adjournment.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon K Lockett in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered the Defendant to follow all conditions of bail.    Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Status of Counsel scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM040310  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08-28-2015

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon K Lockett
Current: 2950 N 47th St., Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 09-01-2015)
Prior: 2950N 47th St., Milwaukee, WI 53210
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brandon K Lockett in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#15-169
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23, however, following September 14, 2015, this case will be reassigned to branch 45, Judge Havas. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Defendant informed the court that he will be hiring a private attorney.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 23.
Case recalled at 3:22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
